Q-Learning¶

Implements Optimistic Q-Learning for policies in pynfg.iterSemiNFG objects

Created on Fri Mar 22 15:32:33 2013

Copyright (C) 2013 James Bono (jwbono@gmail.com)

GNU Affero General Public License

Author: Dongping Xie

class pynfg.levelksolutions.qlearning.QLearning(G, specs)[source]¶

Finds the uncoordinated best policy using Q-learning.

Parameters:
  • Game (iterSemiNFG) – The iterated semi-NFG on which to perform the RL
  • specs (dict) – A nested dictionary contained specifications of the game. See below for details

The specs dictionary is a triply nested dictionary. The first level of keys is player names. For each player there is an entry for the player’s:

Level : int
The player’s level
w : float
The learning rate
delta : float
The discount factor

The rest of the entries are basenames. The value of each basename is a dictionary containing:

N : int
The number of training episodes
r_max : float
(Optional) a guess of upperbound of reward in a single time
step. The default is 0 if no value is specified.
solve_game(setCPT=False)[source]¶

Solves the game sfor specified player levels

train_node(bn, level, setCPT=False)[source]¶

Solve for the optimal policy using Optimistic Q-learning. Optimistic Q-Learning is an off-policy TD control RL algorithm

Parameters:
  • bn (str) – The basename of the node with the CPT to be trained
  • level (int) – The level at which to train the basename
pynfg.levelksolutions.qlearning.qlearning_dict(G, Level, w, N, delta, r_max=0, L0Dist=None)[source]¶

Creates the specs shell for a game to be solved using Q learning.

Parameters:G (iterSemiNFG) – An iterated SemiNFG

See also

See the Q Learning documentation (above) for details of the optional arguments
